page.title: 01Killilan and Camasluinie
page.content: Two rivers run into the head of Loch long. The Ling seperates Cattadale Estate from Killilan Estate and the Elchaig seerates the killilan estate from Inverinate Estate. On the east bank of the Ling stands the school and school house, not used because the roll dropped to 5. Killilan village consists of 6 houses one lodge and a hall. Only 3 houses are occupied, there was a post office but that closed last month. South of the Elchaig is Camasluinie which consists of 3 crofts run as a co-operative. There are 6 houses, all of which are lived in. Sheep and cttle are farmed and the little arable ground is worked. There is also hillgrazing and some uncultivated woodland.
